meta.name: description
meta.content: Moses Lake School District is a dynamic district that covers over 400 square miles in Grant County and serves 8,700+ students. We proudly educate in 16 schools, comprised of one high school, one technical skill center, three middle schools, and ten elementary schools– with a second high school slated for completion in 2022. We employ 1100+ professionals dedicated to the development and well-being of our learning community.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Moses Lake, School District, Education, Washington State

Your first stop for Students, Teachers, and Parents to find resources and information regarding classrooms, technology, and more!

h2.a: Moses Lake is a great place...

div.br: April 6, Governor Inslee and Superintendent Reykdal have confirmed school facilities will remain closed for on-site instruction for the entirety of the school year.

Superintendent Dr. Joshua Meek affirms, "As our state continues our efforts at 'flattening the curve' by staying home and staying healthy, the Governor's decision is as expected, and we are starting to see some impacts of these aggressive moves. Unfortunately, this mandate also means our inability to return to our school buildings this school year."
We understand you have many questions– What does this mean for my child's education? How are we moving forward? What will graduation look like?

"The good news is that our dedicated team of staff has already been working hard to provide essential services and remote delivery," says Meek. "We already have the systems and ability to maintain connections with our learning community, and will continue to provide:

div.div: • Remote delivery of instruction
• Food and child care services
We will continue to do our very best to meet our student's needs– this mandate just extends our efforts."

div.br: We anticipate more details and instruction from the state and will continue to provide more information as it becomes available.
